taxonomy.title: Office of the Historian Subject Taxonomy of the History of U.S. Foreign Relations

description.p: The Subject Taxonomy of the History of U.S. Foreign Relations is a hierarchical taxonomy that consists of categories and tags. The taxonomy is organized into three top-level categories: People, Places, and Topics. Below these top-level categories are additional nested levels of categories and tags, becoming more specific at deeper levels.

Each category and tag conforms to the following structure: it must contain an "id" and "label", and optionally can contain a "definition" and/or "usage-hint". The "id" uniquely identifies a tag in the taxonomy and should be lower-cased and hyphen-delimited. The "label" is how the item is displayed to end users. The "definition" defines the item and will be displayed to all users. The "usage-hint" contains instructions to staff who perform the tagging about how to use. To create a definition for a tag, place a "definition" element after an entry's label. To add a usage hint for a tag, place a "usage-hint" element after the label (or after the "definition" element, if one already exists).

category.label: People
category.definition: Contains lists of Presidents and Secretaries of State in chronological order.
category.usage-hint: For people named in resources, only use a person tag if the resource is relevant to their service as President or Secretary.

category.label: Presidents
category.definition: Presidential administrations in chronological order. (P) is appended to a President's name in cases where the President also served as Secretary of State. A range of years is appended in cases where the President served in two non-consecutive administrations.

category.label: Secretaries of State
category.definition: Secretaries of State in chronological order. (S) is appended to a Secretary's name in cases where the Secretary also served as President. A range of years is appended in cases where the Secretary served non-consecutively.

category.label: Places
category.definition: Territories on today's map of the world, as classified by status and region by the Bureau of Intelligence and Research, U.S. Department of State. (The current list was taken from Independent States and Dependencies, accessed on January 3, 2013.)

category.label: Dependencies and Areas of Special Sovereignty

tag.label: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Collective Security
tag.definition: The general concept of collective security. Specific treaties and organizations have their own tags.

tag.label: Confidence-Building Measures
tag.definition: Measures taken to reduce fear of attack.
tag.usage-hint: These measures will usually be explicitly be labeled as such by negotiating partners.

category.label: Department of State
category.usage-hint: Do not use as tag; this term is too general.

tag.label: Organization and Management
tag.definition: Internal management of the Department itself—i.e., rules, regulations, (re-)organization, etc.—rather than the management of foreign relations.

tag.label: Personnel: Demographics
tag.definition: Analyses or censuses of the composition of Department personnel—e.g., race, gender, educational background, etc.

tag.label: New International Economic Order
tag.definition: The proposal made in the 1970s by developing countries to replace the Bretton Woods system

category.label: Global Issues
category.usage-hint: Do not use as tag; this term is too general.

tag.label: Antisemitism
tag.definition: Includes anti-Jewish attitudes and policies as well as programs to combat anti-Jewish sentiments, discrimination, and governmental action against individuals, property, community institutions, and/or religious facilities affiliated or perceived to be affiliated with Jewish persons or faith.
tag.usage-hint: As delineated in a 2010 fact sheet by the U.S. Department of State's Special Envoy to Monitor and Combat Anti-Semitism and affirmed by the Office of Religious Freedom in 2020, criticism of Israel similar to that leveled against any other country should not be categorized as anti-Semitic. (References: • https://2009-2017.state.gov/j/drl/rls/fs/2010/122352.htm • https://www.state.gov/defining-anti-semitism/ )

tag.label: Civil Rights
tag.definition: Citizens’ rights as established by law and protected by national or state constitution.
tag.usage-hint: Works on the rights of persons regardless of their legal, socioeconomic or cultural status and as recognized by the international community should be entered under the broader term .

tag.label: Detainees
tag.definition: People held in custody or confinement who are not accorded the legal status of other terms in this taxonomy—i.e., or

tag.label: HIV/AIDS
tag.definition: Includes monitoring, research, and efforts to treat and control human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infections and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) disease as well as policies affecting individuals and communities impacted by HIV/AIDS.

tag.label: LGBTQ+ Rights
tag.definition: Includes policies, programs, negotiations, and treatment related to the rights of individuals who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, asexual, intersex, transgender, nonbinary, gender-fluid, queer, or members of other gender or sexual minorities.

tag.label: Information Programs
tag.definition: U.S. information activity in foreign countries

tag.label: International Organizations
tag.definition: Organizations which do not have specific tags, or for general works on international organizations.
tag.usage-hint: If an organization begins to appear frequently, please suggest a separate tag for the organization.

tag.label: Conference on Security and Cooperation in Europe
General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade
Non-governmental Organizations
tag.definition: Organizations which are not affiliated with governments—e.g., Red Cross, Human Rights Watch, Doctors without Borders.

category.label: Politico-Military issues
category.usage-hint: Do not use as tag; this term is too general.

tag.label: Military Intervention, Presence and Withdrawal
tag.definition: Military action not covered by a specific tag under

tag.label: Afghanistan Conflict (2001)
tag.definition: U.S. military presence in Afghanistan post-2001

tag.label: Arab-Israeli Dispute
tag.definition: The ongoing conflict in the Middle East

tag.label: Iraq War (2003)
tag.definition: U.S. military presence in Iraq post-2003
